column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Arad ( Romania )
#Text=Arad
#Text=is an industrial city of some 160,000 population at the western edge of Romania , close to the border with Hungary .
#Text=It is a regional transportation hub and a convenient place to stop over on a journey between those countries .
#Text=There is an intact Vauban-style fortress and an interesting old town with a great number of historic buildings .
#Text=Most of them date from the Habsburg era , ranging from Baroque to Art Nouveau .
#Text=While some have been recently renovated , others are left in a state of dilapidation .
#Text=The city 's cultural life is marked by a Philharmonic Orchestra , several theatres and a museum complex .
#Text=The latter is particularly interesting for history buffs , as it showcases evidence from various eras of human history that have been discovered in this area .
#Text=The Arad county wine route starts a few kilometer east of the city .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest commercial airport is Timisoara ( Traian Vuia TSR ) 40 km south , with 6 or 7 flights a day to Bucharest , and other European destinations .
#Text=Budapest ( Ferihegy BUD ) airport 230 km north-west has extensive connections .
#Text=Arad Airport
#Text=( Aeroportul Internațional Arad ASW ) ( 4 km west of the city ) .
#Text=Has only an occasional holiday charter flight .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Arad is on the main highway E68 between Budapest and Bucharest .
#Text=There are buses every hour or two to Timisoara ( 60-90 min ) ; change there for Bucharest .
#Text=Buses run every 30 min to Budapest , the fastest in only two hours .
#Text=For Transylvania , four or five buses run daily to Deva ( 3 hr ) , Sibiu ( 5 hr ) and Brasov ( 8 hr ) .
#Text=There are four buses to Cluj Napoca ( 4-6 hr ) .
#Text=The bus station is in the Atrium Centre on Aurel Vlaicu Bvd , 200 m west of the railway station and 2 km north of city centre .
#Text=By train
#Text=There are five direct trains a day to Budapest Keleti , taking 4 hr 30 min , fare 100 lei .
#Text=( This includes an hour waiting at the border ; there 's also a one-hour time switch between Romania and Hungary . )
#Text=The last direct train is at 15:30 , but there 's a 17:00 indirect route taking six hours .
#Text=The 01:00 train is a through-service to Vienna .
#Text=There are only two direct services to Bucharest , both overnight , 11 hr .
#Text=The best daytime connection is via the midday train to Timișoara .
#Text=For Transylvania , take the mid-afternoon train running through Deva ( 3 hr ) and Sibiu ( 6 hr ) to Brasov ( 10 hr ) .
#Text=There are two direct trains to Iași ( one daytime 14 hrs , one overnight 17 hr ) via Cluj Napoca .
#Text=There 's one other direct and two indirect services to Cluj Napoca ( 5-6 hr ) .
#Text=All passenger trains are run by CFR Calatori .
#Text=( Gara Arad ) is 2 km north of the city centre at Piața Gării 8-9 .
#Text=The interior is modernised ; few facilities within but lots of fast food places , small supermarkets , currency exchange etc just outside on the main boulevard .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Most sights , eating and accommodation are a short walk from City Hall .
#Text=Buses and trams run along the main strip here , Bulevard Revolutiei .
#Text=At its north end this curves west into Calea Aurel Vlaicu , with the bus & railway stations .
#Text=Taxis and car hire are readily available .
#Text=See
#Text=Holy Trinity Orthodox Cathedral
#Text=( Catedrala Ortodoxă " Sfânta Treime " ) , Bulevardul Revolutiei .
#Text=Built in 1992-2006 , the interior was re-plastered & repainted in 2018 , with wooden scaffolding filling the northern part near the iconostasis .
#Text=The murals at the southern part , by the entrance , look very fresh .
#Text=Lutheran Church
#Text=( Biserica Roșie , " Red church " ) , Bd .
#Text=Revoluției 61 .
#Text=Built in 1906 from red bricks ( hence the nickname ) , Gothic Revival style .
#Text=Administrative Palace
#Text=( Palatul Administrativ ) , Bd .
#Text=Revoluției 75 .
#Text=Impressive city hall , built in 1876 in Renaissance Revival style .
#Text=Neumann Palace
#Text=( Palatul Neumann ) , Bd .
#Text=Revoluției 78/str .
#Text=Horia ( across the city hall ) .
#Text=Representative building created for a very rich industrialist in 1891 – 92 , eclectic style .
#Text=Today it houses a number of shops as well as the private Vasile Goldiș University .
#Text=The former ballroom was converted into an auditorium for 200 students .
#Text=Cultural Palace & Museum
#Text=( Palatul Cultural & Complexul Muzeal ) , Piaţa George Enescu 1 ( by City Hall ) .
#Text=Museum Tu - Su 09:00 - 17:00 .
#Text=Imposing cultural complex , dating from 1911-13 , in an eclectic style mix of neoclassical , Gothic and Renaissance elements .
#Text=The museum has three divisions : fine arts , natural sciences , and archaeology/history .
#Text=The philharmonic orchestra ( filarmonia ) has regular concerts : the box office is in the Ioan Slavici Theatre . 2 lei .
#Text=Just east of the Palace is the Mures river , with a promenade for strolling , and a children 's play-park .
#Text=Moise Nicoară National College
#Text=( Colegiul Național " Moise Nicoară " ) .
#Text=Stately school building , built from 1869 – 1873 with Renaissance and Baroque elements .
#Text=It was thoroughly refurbished after 2010 and made one of Romania 's best equipped schools .
#Text=St. Anthony of Padova Church
#Text=( Biserica Sf . Anton de Padova ) .
#Text=Roman Catholic cathedral built in 1904 in neo-Renaissance style .
#Text=Ioan Slavici Classical Theatre
#Text=( Teatrul Clasic „ Ioan Slavici ” ) .
#Text=Elegant neoclassical theatre building , completed in 1874 .
#Text=Avram Iancu square
#Text=( Piața Avram Iancu ) .
#Text=The city 's main square , with a central green space and monument to the Unknown Soldier .
#Text=Surrounding buildings include the theatre to the north and the Art-Nouveau Nádasdy House to the west .
#Text=House with locked log
#Text=( Casa cu lacăt ) .
#Text=One of the oldest secular buildings in the city , built for a Viennese merchant in 1815 .
#Text=The building 's distinctive mark , a brass-coated log , was modeled after the famous " Stock-im-Eisen " in central Vienna and used by travelling journeymen to leave a mark of their guild .
#Text=After being stolen ( and recovered ) in 1994 , the log was moved to the Museum of Art , to protect it from other thieves .
#Text=Synagogue
#Text=.
#Text=Reformed synagogue , built from 1828 – 1834 , neoclassical style with Greek and Tuscan elements .
#Text=Serbian Orthodox Saint Peter and Paul Church
#Text=( Biserica Sârbească ) .
#Text=Baroque church , built around 1700 ( the city 's oldest church that has survived in its original form ) , with a high steeple .
#Text=Cathedral of the Nativity of John the Baptist
#Text=( Catedrala „ Nașterea Sf . Ioan Botezătorul ” ) .
#Text=Old Romanian Orthodox cathedral , built from 1862 – 65 in Baroque revival style .
#Text=Three blocks west of Piața Avram Iancu , Reconciliation Park ( Parcul Reconcilierii ) with the Statue of Liberty ( Statuia Libertății ) .
#Text=A monument to the " 13 Martyrs of Arad " , rebel generals who were executed by Austrian forces after the failed Hungarian Revolution of 1849 .
#Text=Art Nouveau architecture

#Text=( or Secession style , as it was called in Austro-Hungary ) : several highly decorative examples of this early 20th-century style , similar to those found in Budapest or other cities of the former Danube Monarchy , with their elaborate floral or geometric ornamentation .
#Text=However , most of them are in a rather sad state of preservation .
#Text=Notable instances include ( Str .
#Text=Goldiș Vasile 1-3 ) , ( Str . Horia 3-5/Str .
#Text=Episcopiei 2 ) , ( Str .
#Text=General Vasile Milea 19 ) .
#Text=Trajan Bridge
#Text=( Podul Traian ) .
#Text=Iron bridge over the Mureș river , dating from 1910 – 13 , carrying road and tramway .
#Text=Rehabilitated in 2010 for the bridge 's 100th anniversary .
#Text=East of the river , the is an 18th-century Vauban-style fortification on the site of an earlier Ottoman fort .
#Text=But it 's a military base and closed to the public ; you ca n't even see much of the exterior among the tangled shrubs .
#Text=Ruins of the Franciscan Church
#Text=( Biserica Franciscană ) .
#Text=Cannot be visited regularly , as it is in the citadel and therefore part of the restricted military area .
